thread.title: ‘Tiny Shoulders: Rethinking Barbie’ Review: A Brand Tries to Doll Up Its Image

author: John Anderson
title: ‘Tiny Shoulders: Rethinking Barbie’ Review: A Brand Tries to Doll Up Its Image
text:
Barbie has come a long way since those years when my daughters’ playroom resembled a Dante-esque hellscape littered with skinny naked bodies, legs akimbo, hair askew and which were—I was always assured—in the process of getting dressed. They never quite did. And Barbie has never quite escaped the rap of being the root of all evil—that is, the warped body image of American girls who want to be Barbie and shouldn’t.
In “Tiny Shoulders: Rethinking Barbie,” director Andrea Blaugrund Nevins dives into the venerable controversies...
